captions.text: No. You do not push and sh--

Mr. Duvall: Do you have
anything else you wanna say?

No, I can't answer any
more questions

Until I have a parent
or lawyer present.
Miss smith?

Whoever wrote it probably didn't
think anyone would ever see it?

I hope that nobody else
ever does see it.
( <i>excited tribal theme playing</i> )

Mom, can you pick me up?
I'm scared.

"janis ian, dyke"?
Oh, that's original.

"too gay to function"?!
Hey!

That's only okay
when I say it.

Did you write this?
No, I swear!

Then you told somebody!
She told!

You little bitch!
You're a bitch!

Yeah!
Take your top off!

Now, here's what
we're gonna do--
Ron, come quick!

They've gone wild.
The girls have gone wild.

Cady: <i>It was full-tilt</i>
<i>jungle madness.</i>
( <i>lions roaring</i> )
<i>And it wasn't going away.</i>

Hey, I pulled these two
off each other.

Coach carr, step away
from the underage girls.
Let me help you down there.

Hell, no! I did not leave
the southside for this!
( <i>glass shatters, alarm rings</i> )
( <i>girls scream</i> )
Oh, crap! My hair!

All junior girls report
to the gymnasium immediately!
Immediately!

comments.author: Katie Schumaker

comments.text:
In reality, the sprinklers would not activate; they only do so 
involuntarily if a fire heats up the valve, and only that sprinkler would 
pour (much stronger than it was depicted here). In that case, the alarm 
would sound, but not the other way. It's a common Hollywood mistake. Also, 
why did Mr. Duvall activate the alarm with a European-standard break-glass 
"call point," not a pull station like virtually every building in America?
